subject: GRK
title: Beg. Class. Grk. I
info: Introduction to grammar/vocabulary of classical Greek as written in Athens in 5th/4th centuries BCE. Forms/simple constructions. Some reading of simple, heavily adapted passages from ancient texts.

subject: GRK
title: Beg. Class. Grk. II
info:
Continuation of Greek 1001. More complex constructions, including participles, clauses, indirect discourse. Some reading of adapted passages from ancient texts.

prereq: Grade of at least C- or S in 1001 or dept consent

subject: GRK
title: Intermediate Greek Prose
info:
Introduction to Athenian prose authors of 5th/4th centuries BCE. Readings of continuous passages of unadapted Greek texts (history, speeches). Review of grammar/vocabulary. Some discussion of major themes/issues in Greek culture as illustrated by texts.

prereq: Grade of at least C- or S in 1002 or 5001 or instr consent

subject: GRK
title: Intermediate Greek Poetry
info:
Introduction to Greek epic poetry. Readings of selections from Homer's Iliad and Odyssey. Quantitative meter and poetic devices. Discussion of major themes and issues as developed in Homer's poetry.

prereq:  dept consent

subject: GRK
title: Intens. Grk. Rec.
info: Drills and composition exercises to help students learn classical Greek.  Students must also register for 3111 when taking this course.

subject: GRK
title: Intermediate Greek Poetry
info: Readings in ancient Greek poetry. Introduction to Greek meter. Homer and tragedy offered in alternate years.

subject: GRK
title: Adv Grk Oratory
info: One or more appropriate authors studied during each course offering.

subject: GRK
title: Adv Grk Tragedy
info: Course is replaced by 5100.

subject: GRK
title: Adv Grk Comedy
info: Advanced readings in Greek comedy.

subject: GRK
title: Adv Grk History
info: Advanced readings from the Greek historians; traditions of Greek historiography.

subject: GRK
title: Adv Grk: Phil
info: Course replaced by 5100.

subject: GRK
title: Adv Grk: Relig.
info: Course replaced by 5100.

subject: GRK
title: Adv Grk Epic
info: Course replaced by 5100.

subject: GRK
title: Adv Grk Lyric
info: Course replaced by 5100.

subject: GRK
title: Adv Grk Romance
info: Course replaced by 5100.

subject: GRK
title: Adv Grk: Late Grk
info: Course replaced by 5100.

subject: GRK
title: Directed Studies
info:
Guided individual reading or study.

prereq: instr consent

subject: GRK
title: Directed Research
info:
Research project pertaining to ancient world, using documents or primary sources along with secondary sources. Students select project in consultation with faculty member.

prereq: Course is open to second semester juniors and seniors, major in CNRC, or RelS 

Students enrolling in this directed research course will complete the University's common Directed Research contract with the faculty mentor/evaluator. The Faculty member will ensure academic standards are upheld, including:
- the work proposed is at the appropriate level for the course, academic in nature, and the student will be involved intellectually in the project.
- the project scope is reasonable for one semester and the number of credits specified (42 hours of work per credit)
- the faculty mentor is qualified to serve in this role - assessment of student learning and grading criteria are clear and appropriate
- the student will be working in a respectful, inclusive environment
The contract will include the learning objectives for the course, the methods that will be employed, and how assessment will be conducted by the faculty mentor. The contract must be approved by the DUGS/academic approver of the major before the student can register.

subject: GRK
title: Intens. Class. Grk.
info: Introduction to classical Greek. Covers two semesters of material in one semester.

subject: GRK
title: Int Greek Prose: Grad Research
info:
Introduction to Athenian prose authors of 5th/4th centuries BCE. Readings of continuous passages of unadapted Greek texts (history, speeches). Review of grammar/vocabulary. Some discussion of major themes/issues in Greek culture as illustrated by texts.

prereq: Grade of at least [C- or S] in [1002 or 5001] or [instr consent, grad student]

subject: GRK
title: Int Greek Poetry Grad Research
info:
Introduction to Greek epic poetry. Readings of selections from Homer's Iliad and Odyssey. Quantitative meter and poetic devices. Discussion of major themes and issues as developed in Homer's poetry.

prereq: dept consent

subject: GRK
title: Adv.Comp.
info: English-to-Greek verse composition or writing styles of individual Greek authors.

subject: GRK
title: Advanced Reading
info:
Reading in Greek texts/authors. Texts/authors vary.

prereq: [GRK 3004 or equiv], at least two yrs of college level Greek. Must contact Classical and Near Eastern Studies department for permission to register.

subject: GRK
title: Biblical/Patristic
info: Septuagint, Philo, Josephus, New Testament, Apostolic Fathers, and other patristic literature to 5th century CE. Reading/discussion of selected texts in major genres.

subject: GRK
title: Advanced Greek Prose
info:
The primary material for this course will be a selection of readings from three or more different
Greek prose authors connected by genre (e.g. historical writing, philosophy, oratory, novel),
theme (e.g. medicine, Athenian politics of the 5 th /4 th centuries, religious innovation), period (e.g.
classical period, Second Sophistic), or the like. Primary readings and critical approach will vary
from year to year, making the course repeatable. Some modern secondary reading will be
assigned to provide a basis for discussion and a model for student written work.

prereq: [GRK 3004 or equiv], at least two yrs of college level Greek. Contact the Classical & Near Eastern Religions & Cultures Department (CNRC) with any questions.

subject: GRK
title: Grk Lit: Oratory
info: One or more authors.

subject: GRK
title: Grk Lit:  Tragedy
info: Reading of Greek tragedy.

subject: GRK
title: Comedy
info: Readings in Greek comedy.

subject: GRK
title: History
info: Readings from Greek historians. Traditions of Greek historiography.

subject: GRK
title: Philosophy
info: Readings from one or more works of Plato or Aristotle in original Greek. Selections vary.

subject: GRK
title: Lit: Relig. Texts
info: Readings in Greek literature.

subject: GRK
title: Grk Lit:  Epic
info: Readings in Greek literature.

subject: GRK
title: Grk Lit: Lyric
info: Selections from Greek lyric poets.

subject: GRK
title: Grk Lit: Romance
info: Readings in Greek literature.

subject: GRK
title: Later Authors
info: Readings in Greek literature.

subject: GRK
title: Class Authors
info: Selected topics in classical Greek literature. Topics specified in Class Schedule.

subject: GRK
title: Prose Comp.
info:
Moving step by step through Ancient Greek grammar, starting with simple sentences and progressing to complex ones. Course ends with students translating short passages of modern English prose into Greek.

prereq: Grad student or instr consent

subject: GRK
title: Text Criticism
info:
Theory/practice. Elements of paleography and manuscript study. Tools for analyzing textual apparatus; constructing a critical edition of a literary text.

prereq: Grad student or instr consent

subject: GRK
title: Grk Paleography
info:
Analysis of various hands used in Greek manuscripts with attention to date/provenance. History of transmission of Greek literature.

prereq: Grad student or instr consent

subject: GRK
title: Intro: Hist-Comp Greek & Latin
info: Historical/comparative grammar of Greek and Latin from their Proto-Indo-European origins to classical norms.

subject: GRK
title: History of Greek
info: Reading and formal analysis of documents illustrating evolution of Greek language from Mycenaean to modern times.

subject: GRK
title: Sight Reading
info:
Practice in reading Greek texts at sight.

prereq: Enrollment in a grad program in Department of Classical/Near Eastern Studies

subject: GRK
title: Directed Studies
info:
Guided individual reading or study.
Prereq Grad student or instr consent.

subject: GRK
title: Dir Research
info:
Supervised original research on topic chosen by student.
Prereq Grad student or instr consent.

subject: GRK
title: Directed Instruct.
info:
Supervised teaching internship.
Prereq Grad student or instr consent.

subject: GRK
title: Readings in Greek Prose
info:
Reading and discussion of ancient Greek prose texts.

prereq: Advanced grad student

subject: GRK
title: Greek Texts
info:
Students attend 3xxx Greek courses. Supplementary work at discretion of instructor.

prereq: 3111 or dept consent; not for students in dept of Classical and Near East Studies

subject: GRK
title: Readings in Greek Verse
info:
Reading/discussion of ancient Greek poetic texts.

prereq: Advanced grad student

subject: GRK
title: Greek Lit. I
info: Extensive selections from all genres of Greek literature of archaic and early classical periods.

subject: GRK
title: Greek Lit. II
info: Extensive selections from Greek authors of the classical and Hellenistic eras.

subject: GRK
title: Readings in Greek Texts
info:
Reading/discussion of literary or documentary texts from Greek antiquity. Topics may include subjects that draw on various of sources, genres, or methods.

prereq: Advanced grad student

subject: GRK
title: Readings in Patristic Greek
info:
Reading/discussion of early Christian texts in Greek.

prereq: Advanced grad student

subject: GRK
title: Seminar
info: Various topics in Greek literature examined in depth with emphasis on current scholarship and original student research.
